item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，中国计划在 2025 年实现创纪录的预算赤字（占 GDP 的 4
item.description: 两位知情人士称，中国领导人上周同意将明年的预算赤字占国内生产总值（GDP）的比例提高到4%，达到历史最高水平，同时保持5%左右的经济增长目标。【原文：Chinese leaders agreed last week to raise the budget deficit to 4% of gross domestic product (GDP) next year, its highest on record, while maintaining an economic growth target of around 5%, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴将以 10 亿美元出售连锁商场，作为最新改革的一部分
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团周二表示，将以 74 亿元人民币（10.2 亿美元）的总收益向纺织服装企业 Youngor Fashion 出售其百货业务 Intime。【原文：Alibaba Group on Tuesday said it would sell its department store arm, Intime, to textiles and clothing enterprise Youngor Fashion for gross proceeds of 7.4 billion yuan ($1.02 billion).】

item.title: 雪佛龙澳大利亚公司与美国铝业公司签署长期天然气供应协议
item.description: 美国石油巨头雪佛龙公司的澳大利亚分公司周二表示，将在 2028 年起的 10 年间向铝生产商美国铝业公司（Alcoa）供应总计 130 千兆焦耳的天然气。【原文：U.S. oil giant Chevron's Australian unit said on Tuesday it would supply a total of 130 petajoules of gas to aluminium producer Alcoa over a 10-year period starting 2028.】

item.title: 沃尔玛与美团外卖在中国合作
item.description: 沃尔玛中国周二宣布，已与中国最大的餐饮外卖公司美团达成新的战略合作伙伴关系。【原文：Walmart China announced on Tuesday it has entered into a new strategic partnership with China's biggest food delivery company Meituan .】

item.title: 央行会议前亚洲股市漂移，美元坚挺
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市走高，美元坚挺，交易员们在为本周的一系列央行会议做准备，美国联邦储备委员会可能会降息，而日本央行暂时按兵不动。【原文：Asian stocks edged higher and the dollar held firm on Tuesday as traders braced for a slate of central banks meetings this week that is likely to see the U.S. Federal Reserve deliver a rate cut and the Bank of Japan stand pat for now.】

item.title: 官方数据显示，中国资本市场 11 月资金外流创历史新高
item.description: 根据跟踪股票和债券跨境投资的官方数据，11 月份中国资本市场出现了创纪录的 457 亿美元资金外流。【原文：China's capital markets witnessed a record outflow of $45.7 billion in November, according to official data tracking cross-border investments in stocks and bonds.】

item.title: 美联储决议公布前油价维持不变
item.description: 周二亚市早盘，油价在区间内震荡，因为投资者担心中国的需求，并等待周三美国利率决议对市场的进一步指引。【原文：Oil prices were range-bound in early Asian trading on Tuesday as investors worried about Chinese demand and awaited further market direction from a U.S. interest rate decision due on Wednesday.】

item.title: 2025 年降息押注消失，美元获得支撑
item.description: 周二，在美国预期降息前夕，美元保持坚挺，接近近期高点，交易商将长期利率假设调高。【原文：The dollar held firm and near recent peaks on Tuesday, on the eve of an expected interest rate cut in the United States, as traders ratchet long-term rate assumptions higher.】

item.title: Facebook 母公司 Meta 就剑桥分析诉讼与澳大利亚隐私监管机构达成和解
item.description: 澳大利亚隐私监管机构周二表示，Meta Platforms 已同意支付 5000 万澳元（约合 3185 万美元）的和解金，从而结束了 Facebook 母公司因剑桥分析丑闻而陷入的旷日持久、耗资巨大的法律诉讼程序。【原文：Meta Platforms has agreed to a A$50 million settlement ($31.85 million), Australia's privacy watchdog said on Tuesday, closing long-drawn, expensive legal proceedings for the Facebook parent over the Cambridge Analytica scandal.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国将加大对中国电信美国分公司的打击力度
item.description: 一位消息人士告诉路透社，美国商务部正着手进一步打击中国电信美国分公司，因为担心该公司可能通过其美国云计算和互联网业务向中国政府提供美国数据，从而获取美国数据。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department is moving to further crackdown on China Telecom's U.S. unit from over concerns it could exploit access to American data through their U.S. cloud and internet businesses by providing it to Beijing, a source told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国能源部确定了三个电力传输优先地区
item.description: 美国能源部周一宣布，该部已确定美国有三个地区亟需新建输电基础设施，并有资格获得未来的联邦资金支持。【原文：The U.S. Department of Energy has zeroed in on three regions of the country it has determined are in major need of new electric transmission infrastructure and eligible for future federal funding, it announced on Monday.】

item.title: 调查显示，12 月份澳大利亚消费者对经济忧心忡忡
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于对经济前景的担忧超过了人们自身财务状况的改善，澳大利亚消费者情绪在12月份有所回落。【原文：Australian consumer sentiment took a step back in December as concerns about the economic outlook outweighed an improvement in people's own finances, a survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚将埃克森公司的本地汽油品牌告上法庭，指控其虚假燃料表述
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监督机构周二表示，已将埃克森美孚的本地品牌子公司告上法庭，称其误导了昆士兰州六家品牌加油站的顾客。【原文：Australia's competition watchdog said on Tuesday it has taken Exxon Mobil's local brand affiliate to court, claiming it misled customers about fuel sold at six of its branded petrol stations in Queensland.】

item.title: 窃取特斯拉商业机密的中国居民在美国被判 2 年监禁
item.description: 美国司法部周一表示，一名居住在中国的德裔加拿大人因窃取特斯拉电动汽车商业机密用于其竞争性电动汽车电池业务而在美国被判处 24 个月监禁。【原文：A German-Canadian resident of China was sentenced to 24 months in prison in the U.S. for stealing electric vehicle trade secrets from Tesla for his competing EV battery business, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）记者称，特朗普将在 X 日会见 Netflix 联席首席执行官泰德-萨兰多斯（Ted Sarandos
item.description: 美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）记者 Alayna Treene 周一在前身为 Twitter 的 X 上表示，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普定于周二在 Mar-a-Lago 与 Netflix 联席首席执行官泰德-萨兰多斯（Ted Sarandos）会面。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump is scheduled to meet with Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos on Tuesday at Mar-a-Lago, CNN reporter Alayna Treene said on Monday on X, formerly known as Twitter.】

item.title: 董事会专家称，税费激增后，Perpetual-KKR 交易对股东并非最佳选择
item.description: 澳大利亚 Perpetual 公司周二表示，一位独立专家认为，该资产管理公司将财富管理和企业信托业务出售给 KKR 的计划不符合投资者的最佳利益。【原文：Australia's Perpetual said on Tuesday an independent expert has opined the asset manager's plan to sell the wealth management and corporate trust business to KKR would not serve the best interest of investors after a tax bill blowout.】

item.title: 纽柯第四季度利润低于预期
item.description: 美国钢铁制造商纽柯公司周一预计，第四季度利润将低于华尔街预期，原因是钢产量减少和平均销售价格下降导致钢厂盈利下滑。【原文：U.S. steelmaker Nucor forecast fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street estimates on Monday, citing a slump in earnings in their steel mills segment caused by decreased volumes and lower average selling prices.】

item.title: Ozy Media 创始人卡洛斯-沃森因诈骗罪被判处近 10 年徒刑
item.description: Ozy Media 创始人卡洛斯-沃森（Carlos Watson）于本周一被判处近 10 年监禁，陪审团于今年 7 月认定他在这家现已倒闭的初创公司的财务以及与谷歌和奥普拉-温弗瑞（Oprah Winfrey）的虚假交易方面向投资者撒谎的罪名成立。【原文：Ozy Media founder Carlos Watson was sentenced on Monday to nearly 10 years in prison, after a jury found him guilty in July of lying to investors about the now-defunct startup's finances and sham deals with Google and Oprah Winfrey.】

item.title: 解释器：美国比特币战略储备如何运作？
item.description: 在当选总统唐纳德-特朗普重申建立美国比特币战略储备的计划后，比特币周一创下了107,000美元以上的历史新高，激起了加密货币多头的热情。以下是该计划的运作方式。【原文：Bitcoin hit a record high above $107,000 on Monday after President-elect Donald Trump reiterated plans to create a U.S. bitcoin strategic reserve, stoking the enthusiasm of crypto bulls. Here's how the plan could work.】

item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: SEC 称，Becton Dickinson 就输液泵风险指控达成和解
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周一表示，已就有关 Becton Dickinson and Co. (BD) 在 Alaris 输液泵相关风险方面误导投资者的指控与该公司达成和解。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Monday that it had settled charges with Becton Dickinson and Co. (BD) over allegations it misled investors about risks associated with its Alaris infusion pump.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称巴西投资者 Tanure 正与卡西诺就 GPA 股份进行初步谈判
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的消息人士透露，巴西投资者纳尔逊-塔努雷（Nelson Tanure）已开始与法国零售商 Casino 初步商谈购买其在超市运营商 GPA , 的至少部分股份，这可能会增加与塔努雷结盟的基金近日积累的股份。【原文：Brazilian investor Nelson Tanure has initiated preliminary discussions with French retailer Casino ,about buying at least part of its shares in supermarket operator GPA ,, according to a source familiar with the matter, potentially adding to a stake amassed by funds allied to Tanure in recent days.】

item.title: 特朗普称 "我们要打掉中间商 "后，保险公司股票下跌
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普称经营药房福利管理公司的医疗保险公司是推高成本的中间商，并表示他计划取消这些公司的作用，此后这些公司的股价周一下跌。【原文：Shares of health insurers operating pharmacy benefit managers fell on Monday after U.S. President-elect Donald Trump called them middlemen who drive up costs and said he plans to eliminate their role.】

item.title: TikTok 诉诸美国最高法院，为避免禁令做最后努力
item.description: TikTok 周一为继续在美国运营做出了最后的努力，请求最高法院暂时阻止一项法律，该法律旨在迫使其中国母公司字节跳动在 1 月 19 日前剥离这款短视频应用，否则将面临禁令。【原文：TikTok made a last-ditch effort on Monday to continue operating in the United States, asking the Supreme Court to temporarily block a law intended to force ByteDance, its China-based parent company, to divest the short-video app by Jan. 19 or face a ban.】

item.title: 美国法官下令重开 Citgo 数据室，重新启动竞标
item.description: 一份法庭文件显示，一名负责监督委内瑞拉所有的 Citgo 石油公司母公司股份拍卖的美国法官周一同意重新开放数据室，允许潜在买家准备新的出价。【原文：A U.S. judge overseeing an auction of shares in the parent of Venezuela-owned Citgo Petroleum on Monday agreed to reopen a data room to allow potential buyers to prepare new bids, a court document showed.】

item.title: 美国将于 2027 年要求汽车安装后排安全带提醒装置
item.description: 美国交通部周一表示，将从 2027 年底开始要求后座提醒系统提高安全带的使用率，以减少近年来不断上升的交通事故死伤人数。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said Monday it will require rear seat reminder systems to boost seat belt use starting in late 2027 in a bid to reduce traffic crash deaths and injuries that have been rising in recent years.】

item.title: 美国债券投资者为 "鹰派减息 "做好准备，唾弃长期债券
item.description: 债券投资者预计美联储将在周三将利率下调四分之一个百分点，他们担心央行将在2025年缩减宽松政策，因为预计特朗普政府将提高通胀率。【原文：Bond investors, expecting the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point on Wednesday, are bracing for the central bank to scale back its easing in 2025 in anticipation of higher inflation under the Trump administration.】

item.title: Meta 为雷朋智能眼镜增加实时翻译和人工智能视频功能
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司周一表示，它已经更新了雷朋 Meta 智能眼镜，使其具备了人工智能视频功能和实时语言翻译功能。【原文：Meta Platforms said on Monday it has updated the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses with AI video capability and real-time language translation functionality.】

item.title: 如果沃尔玛不遵守裁决，墨西哥反垄断机构可能对其处以更多罚款
item.description: 墨西哥反垄断监管机构 Cofece 周一表示，如果沃尔玛的本地子公司 Walmex 不遵守禁止该零售商从事某些被视为非法行为的决议，该机构可能会对其处以最高达收入 8%的罚款。【原文：Mexico's antitrust watchdog Cofece said it could fine Walmart's local unit Walmex up to 8% of its income if it does not comply with a resolution prohibiting the retailer from engaging in certain conduct deemed illegal, the regulator said on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士：阿萨德下台后，叙利亚保留了 26 吨黄金储备
item.description: 四位熟悉情况的人士告诉路透社记者，叙利亚中央银行的金库里有近 26 吨黄金，与 2011 年血腥内战开始时的数量相同，即使在巴沙尔-阿萨德的专制政权混乱倒台之后也是如此。【原文：The vault of Syria's central bank holds nearly 26 tons of gold, the same amount it had at the start of its bloody civil war in 2011, even after the chaotic fall of Bashar al-Assad's despotic regime, four people familiar with the situation told Reuters.】
